Package com.intellij.openapi.vfs.newvfs

Class NewVirtualFileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.vfs.VirtualFileSystem
      • com.intellij.openapi.vfs.newvfs.NewVirtualFileSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CachingVirtualFileSystem, FileSystemInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArchiveFileSystem, LocalFileSystem

    public abstract class NewVirtualFileSystem
extends VirtualFileSystem
implements FileSystemInterface, CachingVirtualFileSystem

    • Constructor Detail

      • NewVirtualFileSystem

        public NewVirtualFileSystem()

    • Method Detail

      • normalize

        protected java.lang.String normalize(java.lang.String path)

        Implementations should convert separator chars to forward slashes and remove duplicates ones, and convert paths to "absolute" form (so that they start from a root that is valid for this FS and could be later extracted with extractRootPath(java.lang.String)).

        Implementations should not normalize paths by eliminating directory traversals or other indirections.

        Returns:
        a normalized path, or null when a path is invalid for this FS.

      • extractRootPath

        protected abstract java.lang.String extractRootPath(java.lang.String normalizedPath)
        IntelliJ platform calls this method with non-null value returned by normalize(java.lang.String), but if something went wrong and an implementation can't extract a valid root path nevertheless, it should return an empty string.

      • findFileByPathIfCached

        public abstract VirtualFile findFileByPathIfCached(java.lang.String path)

      • addVirtualFileListener

        public void addVirtualFileListener(VirtualFileListener listener)
        Description copied from class: VirtualFileSystem
        Adds listener to the file system. Normally one should use VirtualFileManager.VFS_CHANGES message bus topic.

        See Also:

      • getAttributes

        public abstract FileAttributes getAttributes(VirtualFile file)
        Reads various file attributes in one shot (to reduce the number of native I/O calls).
        Parameters:
        file - file to get attributes of.
        Returns:
        attributes of a given file, or null if the file doesn't exist.

      • hasChildren

        public boolean hasChildren(VirtualFile file)
        Returns true if path represents a directory with at least one child. Override if your file system can answer this question more efficiently (e.g. without enumerating all children).
